hero.description: The world's first international standard dedicated to digital customer experience. Optimize your digital channels, mobile apps and online services to deliver exceptional user experience.

overview.title: The Digital Excellence Standard
overview.description: At the core of the new IDCXS standard is the original 5Ps Service Excellence Model, adapted and developed for the digital age. With 3 years of development, trials and improvements, IDCXS is the world's first Digital Customer Experience Standard.

model.title: The 5Ps Model
model.description: The 5Ps model is accepted globally as the core principle for ensuring customer experience service excellence across any type of organisation. It now provides a brilliantly powerful, fool-proof diagnostic tool for analysing your customer experience systems, processes and communications.

development.title: 3 Years of Development
development.description: Developed with many global experts in all aspects of digital delivery, including trials, improvements and a complete review cycle.

experts.title: Global Experts
experts.description: Developed with the participation of many global experts in all aspects of digital delivery to ensure a comprehensive and relevant standard.

diagnostic.title: Diagnostic Tool
diagnostic.description: A brilliantly powerful, fool-proof diagnostic tool for analysing your customer experience systems, processes, communications and much more.

analysis.title: Deep Analysis
analysis.description: Allows organisations to drill down to forensic levels of detail, understanding more clearly where improvements can be made.

management.title: Simplified Management
management.description: Can rationalise key factors into several component elements, making performance analysis more manageable for organisations.

elements.title: The 7 Elements of IDCXS 2022
elements.description: Each element of IDCXS 2022 contains several criteria/clauses that provide clear guidance on how to improve digital customer experience and service excellence.

policies.title: Policies
policies.description: Do your organisation's policies outline the parameters for digital products/services, digital channels, processes and people?

channels.title: Places – Digital Channels
channels.description: Are digital portals, mobile apps, online services designed according to the quality, resilience and robustness needs and expectations of the customer?

products.title: Products / Services
products.description: Is the performance of your products/services fit for purpose and consistent with existing digital performance expectations?
products.point3: Quality and reliability of digital services

processes.title: Processes & Customer Journey Maps
processes.description: How effective are your organisation's processes in delivering the desired outcome to customers and users across all services?

people.title: People
people.description: Are your employees sufficiently skilled and motivated to ensure products and services are delivered to fulfil customer and user needs?

measurement.title: Measurement of Performance
measurement.description: Definition and implementation of performance measurement across all digital services will provide foundations for customer experience service excellence and employee happiness.

results.title: Performance Results
results.description: How can research and other related performance measures identify levels of happiness and satisfaction in customers and employees?

scoring.title: IDCXS 2022 Scoring System
scoring.description: The scoring system of IDCXS 2022 consists of 1,000 Points distributed among each of the 7 sections according to their contribution to digital service excellence delivery.

system.title: Points Distribution
system.total_description: By reviewing the results, your organization can develop an accurate priority list, ensuring resources are used efficiently to improve digital standards across the board.

note.title: Important Note
note.description: The points distribution reflects the increased importance of performance measurement (25%) and digital processes (20%) in modern digital customer experience.

benefits.title: Benefits of IDCXS Certification
benefits.description: Discover how IDCXS certification can transform your digital organization and generate measurable results.

digital_excellence.title: Digital Excellence
digital_excellence.description: Optimize all your digital channels, mobile apps and online services to deliver exceptional user experience.

user_experience.title: Optimal User Experience
user_experience.description: Create intuitive and engaging user experiences that maximize satisfaction and loyalty of digital customers.

competitive_advantage.title: Digital Competitive Advantage
competitive_advantage.description: Stand out from the competition with internationally recognized digital excellence standards.

measurable_results.title: Measurable Results
measurable_results.description: 1,000-point scoring system to accurately assess your digital performance and identify improvement priorities.

employee_satisfaction.title: Employee Satisfaction
employee_satisfaction.description: Improve employee well-being and engagement in the digital environment, creating a productive and satisfied workforce.

data_driven.title: Data-Driven Decisions
data_driven.description: Make informed decisions based on accurate measurements and in-depth analysis of your digital performance.

cta.title: Ready to Transform Your Digital Customer Experience?
cta.description: Join the thousands of organizations that have transformed their digital customer service through IDCXS certification.

hero.title: IEHWS 2023
hero.subtitle: International Employee Happiness and Wellbeing Standard
hero.description: The international standard that reflects the dramatically increased international growth in scale, reach and scope of the need for employers to develop practices that deliver happiness levels and actively promote and support wellbeing within their employees as a key factor contributing to customer service excellence.

overview.title: The Employee Happiness and Wellbeing Standard
overview.description: IEHWS 2023 reflects the dramatically increased international growth in scale, reach and scope of the need for employers to develop practices that deliver happiness levels and actively promote wellbeing of their employees.

primary_aim.title: Primary Aim
primary_aim.description: The primary aim of IEHWS 2023 is to motivate organisations to focus their attention on their biggest asset "their Employees" through the delivery of employee happiness and wellbeing promotion techniques.

focus.title: Focus on Employees
focus.description: Focus attention on the organization's biggest asset: employees.

framework.title: Flexible Framework
framework.description: Contains proven core principles and evolving practices of delivering Employee Happiness to create a flexible yet quantifiable framework.

vector6.title: The Vector 6 Model
vector6.description: IEHWS 2023 uses the platform of the Vector 6 Employee Happiness and Wellbeing Model which is based on 6 criteria PLUS two additional criteria: Measurement of Performance and Performance Results.

measurement.title: Capable of Measurement
measurement.description: The model is capable of measurement and the results can be analysed by any vertical or horizontal organisational sector.

analysis.title: Performance Analysis
analysis.description: Provides guidance for performance analysis and consequent continual improvement for all parties.

improvement.title: Continuous Improvement
improvement.description: Identifies the core criteria that are critical in maintaining positive, energised, effective and respectful relationships between employer and employee.

elements.title: The 8 Criteria of IEHWS 2023
elements.description: Each section of IEHWS 2023 has a number of criteria. Each criterion has a brief descriptive title to assist in identifying the criterion throughout the assessment, implementation, and reporting process.

leadership.title: Values Led Leadership
leadership.description: Leadership that guides the organization according to clear and consistent values.

environment.title: Environment and Climate
environment.description: Creating a positive work environment conducive to wellbeing.

career.title: Career Control
career.description: Development opportunities and control over professional journey.

teamwork.title: Teamwork Led Supervision
teamwork.description: Supervision that promotes teamwork and collaboration.

effectiveness.title: Organisational Effectiveness
effectiveness.description: Effective organizational processes and systems that support employees.

reward.title: Reward and Recognition
reward.description: Reward and recognition systems that value contributions.

measurement.title: Measurement of Performance
measurement.description: Definition and implementation of performance measurement to conduct a full cycle of employee happiness and wellbeing measurement.

results.title: Performance Results
results.description: Documentation and evidence of research results of required employee happiness and wellbeing measurements.

scoring.title: IEHWS 2023 Scoring System
scoring.description: The Institute has developed a scoring model and concept for the standard to provide an accurate assessment of the organisation's performance against each of the criterion within IEHWS 2023.

system.title: Points Distribution
system.total_description: The scoring system ensures consistency of results, allowing, for research purposes, benchmarking and cross-organisational comparisons.

note.title: Three Levels Available
note.description: Three levels can be achieved dependent upon the organisation's performance against the criteria of the standard.

pledge.title: Employee Happiness & Wellbeing Pledge
pledge.description: We believe this to be first of its kind in the world and is aimed at creating a global movement and commitment from Owners, Directors, Leaders and Managers to PLEDGE that they will do everything in their power to make their respective organisational workplaces not just great places to work but uphold their commitment to act in accordance with the principles and foundations included within the Vector 6 Framework.

points.formal_promise: The Pledge is a formal promise or commitment made by an organisation and its employees to uphold certain principles, values and responsibilities in relation to Employee Happiness and Wellbeing.
points.declaration: The Pledge is a declaration of intention to act and behave in a specific way in relation to all things Employee Happiness and Wellbeing.
points.dedication: The Pledge is used to demonstrate dedication and accountability to Employee Happiness and Wellbeing throughout the organisation.
points.commitment: The Pledge is a way to express the Organisations' commitment to employee Happiness and Wellbeing beliefs and actions and can be a powerful tool for creating positive change.

goal.title: Primary Goal
goal.description: Taking the Pledge means a commitment made by the organisation to prioritise the happiness and wellbeing of all employees. The primary goal of the Pledge is to improve the workplace culture through supporting employees not just professionally but also personally.

workplace.title: Workplace Environment
workplace.description: Organisations can enhance a healthy and supportive work environment.

morale.title: Morale and Engagement
morale.description: Improve morale, enhance employee engagement and productivity.

culture.title: Positive Culture
culture.description: Foster a sense of responsibility and create positive change in the organisation.

cta.title: Join the Global Movement
cta.description: Take the Pledge and show your commitment to employee happiness and wellbeing.

pathfinder.title: Pathfinder Surveys
pathfinder.description: Pathfinder surveys are a strategic employee feedback solution developed to enable organisations to identify issues that are negatively impacting Employee Happiness and Wellbeing, whilst allowing organisations to 'Benchmark' their performance with other organisations, globally.

p18.name: P18 - Temperature of the Organisation
p18.description: Will produce first impression results relating to every aspect of the Vector 6 model.

p30.name: P30 - Pulse of the Organisation
p30.description: Will produce results relating to the Pulse of your organisation, 30 questions that are crucial and linked directly from the Vector 6 model.

p60.name: P60 - Strength of the Organisation
p60.description: Will produce results relating to the Strength of your organisation, 60 detailed comprehensive questions covering all aspects and linked directly from the Vector 6 model.

happiness.description: Improve employee happiness and wellbeing experiences, employee satisfaction, employee and employer trust driving customer happiness and improving customer feedback results.

measurable.description: Provide organisations with a measurable platform for consistently delivering the highest levels of employee happiness and wellbeing experience.

engagement.title: Improved Engagement
engagement.description: Improve employee engagement, focus and understanding of the role employees play in delivering continuously improvement in the customer experience.

stability.title: Workforce Stability
stability.description: Maintain workforce stability, productivity, and loyalty throughout the organisation through improved employee happiness and wellbeing.

reputation.description: Enhance the reputation of the organisation and brand as an attractive employer for high quality employees.

hero.title: Understanding TISSE
hero.subtitle: The International Service Excellence Standard
hero.description: TISSE (The International Service Excellence Standard) is the core framework of ICXI for assessing and improving customer service quality. It serves as a global reference for establishing a customer-centric culture and producing measurable results.

definition.title: What is TISSE?
definition.subtitle: The global reference framework for service excellence
definition.main_description: TISSE is much more than just a standard. It's a comprehensive system that transforms how organizations design, deliver, and continuously improve their customer service.

icxi_framework.title: Core ICXI Framework
icxi_framework.description: TISSE forms the foundation of International Customer Experience Institute standards, globally recognized for excellence.

global_reference.description: Used in over 50 countries, TISSE establishes international best practices in customer service.

measurable_results.title: Measurable Results

customer_centric.title: Customer-Centric Culture
customer_centric.description: It helps public and private organizations establish a true culture where the customer is at the heart of all decisions.

eight_domains.title: The 8 Key Domains of TISSE
eight_domains.subtitle: A structured framework for service excellence
eight_domains.description: TISSE is based on eight fundamental domains that cover the entire customer service lifecycle. Each domain is essential for building an exceptional and sustainable customer experience.

continuous_improvement.title: Continuous Improvement
continuous_improvement.description: Establish a culture of innovation and continuous improvement that adapts to market changes and evolving customer expectations.

strategic_value.title: Strategic Value of TISSE
strategic_value.subtitle: Beyond simple transactional interactions
strategic_value.description: TISSE fundamentally transforms how your organization approaches customer service, moving from a reactive approach to a proactive and measurable strategy.

beyond_transactions.title: Beyond Transactions

duration.question: How long does it take to obtain TISSE certification?
duration.answer: The duration varies depending on your organization's current maturity, but on average, the complete process takes between 4 and 8 months. This includes the initial assessment, implementation of improvements, and certification audit.

cost.question: What is the cost of TISSE certification?
cost.answer: The cost depends on your organization's size, the number of sites to certify, and your current level of readiness. Contact us for a personalized assessment and detailed quote. Average ROI is achieved in 6-12 months.

validity.question: What is the validity period of the certification?
validity.answer: TISSE certification is valid for 3 years. Annual surveillance audits are conducted to ensure the maintenance of excellence standards throughout this period.

vs_iso.question: What is the difference between TISSE and ISO 9001?
vs_iso.answer: ISO 9001 focuses on quality management in general, while TISSE is specifically dedicated to customer service excellence. Both standards are complementary and can be integrated to create a holistic management system.

prerequisites.question: Are there prerequisites to start the TISSE process?
prerequisites.answer: There are no formal prerequisites. TISSE adapts to any maturity level. We start with an assessment to identify your starting point and build a personalized plan.

support.question: What support do you offer during the process?
support.answer: We offer comprehensive support: initial audit, team training, implementation assistance, certification audit preparation, and post-certification support. Our experts are with you at every step.
